alert.note: Alert for Larimer (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 03 at 2:42PM MDT until July 03 at 5:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR EAST CENTRAL LARIMER COUNTY... At 242 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms had ended across the warned area. However, between 0.5 and 0.75 inches of rain had fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, gulches, roads, and poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Masonville and Horsetooth Mountain. This includes the southeast portion of the Cameron Peak burn area. This includes the following additional locations... Big Bear. This includes the following streams and drainages... Mill Creek, Big Thompson River, Redstone Creek, Cedar Creek, Dry Creek, Spring Creek, Indian Creek, Buckhorn Creek and North Fork Fish Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Heavy Rainfall will cause flash flooding of small creeks, streams, and ditches in the affected part of the Cameron Peak burn area. Rock slides or debris flows can also be expected across rural roads.
